response.feedback: Incorrect. Two countercurrent mechanisms operate in the kidneys: countercurrent multiplication and countercurrent exchange. Countercurrent multiplication amplifies the osmotic gradient and enables the formation of more concentrated urine via the presence of ADH.

Correct. The presence of ADH amplifies urea recycling, which, in turn, amplifies the osmotic gradient and enables the formation of more concentrated urine. This is otherwise known as countercurrent multiplication.
